result.execSummary:
The defendant Andre D Bailey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

w/attachments
Huber Notice

[MK] cases #15CT571 & #16CM159 called at 11:07am. 
Defendant Andre D Bailey in court with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Case #15CT571-Count #1 and on Case #16CM159-Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #15CT571-Counts #2 & #3.

On Case #15CT571-Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Bailey: 
--To serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for home-care, childcare and work; there is not to be any use of electronic monitoring for service of this jail term; this sentence is to commence on July 21st, 2017 at 6:00pm 
--Mr. Bailey is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with no alcohol or non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--Days credit for time already served: 0 days
--To pay fine of $400  + costs [clerk's calculation:  $1492, plus $56.74 in blood testing fees]  to be paid in $50 per month installments, commencing on  7/31/17 and on the last day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment will result in 60 days in jail with Huber privileges, consecutive
--to submit a DNA sample as required by law
--Revocation of drivers license for 14 months
--AODA assessment
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 14 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed
---------------------------------------------------------------------

On Case #16CM159-Count #1, the Court sentences Mr. Bailey: 
--To serve 15 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges for home-care, childcare and work; there is not to be any use of electronic monitoring for service of this jail term;  consecutive to Case #15CT571 and any other sentence in being 
--Mr. Bailey is required to report for commencement and service of the jail term with no alcohol or non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--to submit a DNA sample as required by law 
--to pay costs under the same payment plan as set in Case #15CT571; non-payment will result in 60 days in jail with Huber privileges, concurrent with the alternate sentence in Case #15CT571 but consecutive to any other sentence 
--Days credit for time already served: 0 days
recess 11:29am
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on July 11, 2017 at 08:15 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on July 6, 2017 at 10:30 am.

ON Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence: 
[MK] cases #15CT571 and #16CM159 called at 8:38am. 
Defendant Andre D Bailey in court with Attorney John V Rhiel.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Officer David Fritsche- sworn & testiifies
--direct examination by ADA Hall
--State's Exhibit #1: disc containing vid-mic footage 
--cross examination by Attorney Rhiel
Arguments given by ADA Hall, by Attorney Rhiel.
The Court finds that there was no stop and there was no seizure. 
The Court and counsel discuss the scheduling of trial.
Attorney Rhiel indicates that, at this point, the Defense does not have objection to the State's Motion for Joinder of these cases. 
The Court grants the Joinder Motion- the cases are joined for trial.  This ruling is subject to reconsideration if Attorney Rhiel formally files an objection within ten days.
recess 9:31am.

Cases 15CT571 and 16CM159 called at 3:46pm.  Clerk - CRHI. 
Attorney Karl E Huebner in court.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews case history, status and filings in both cases. 
Atty. Huebner informs the Court that he spoke with the defendant approximately 20 minutes ago and at that time, the defendant indicated that he has not received notices from the court for either case.   Slight change of address provided by Atty. Huebner - 1708A E. Belleview rather than just 1708 E. Belleview.
Further review of the files regarding the address and response presented by the Court including that the bond signed by the defendant indicates an address of 1708 E. Belleview. 

State moves for issuance of a bench warrant in each file; so ordered by the Court. Body only. 
Court directs that the FSSC and Jury Trial dates remain as scheduled; presents basis. 

Court verifies that Atty. Huebner attempted to file response to the State's motion but they were not received due to technical issues. 
Atty. Huebner indicates that the only motion that is contested is the motion for joinder. 
Court grants all of the motions filed other than the motion for joinder.  The Court will address the contest motion for joinder when the defendant is present at a future hearing. 
Recess 3:57pm.

-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-No possession of any dangerous weapons
-maintain absolute sobriety
-no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid license
